text: Quick one Just wondering if anyone has an idea for this. I have created a porfolio type of page. And added Id elements to each topic so the client can send just the set category out via email but all on the same page.  <http://info.tribalgroup.com/tribal-empower-conference-breakout-sessions#Further-Education>  so this link should only show the main ones in green but shows them all. But once you click Further Education again it works fine. Any Ideas?

I’m still experiencing this issue
It’s not un-minifying any of the css. :disappointed:

*Anyone know which HS Dev is in-charge of that functionality?*

_I think the cause might be that the page I’m working on is set as password protected in HS_

updating this was user error not a HS issue
looking
I checked a few pages and the `hsDebug=true` works fine. What is your page url?
shooting you a DM
Been a while since I worked with Mixitup, but I think you’ll need to read the window.location.hash and feed it into the config object via the built-in .load function
<https://www.kunkalabs.com/mixitup/docs/configuration-object/>
Hey anyone having an issue where a custom module’s css file is throwing 404 errors?
I was earlier, yes, but only in preview windows
I’m getting it on a live page- fortunately no one except our team can view the page anyways(PW protected) but has me a lil concerned.
It's the combined CSS sheet, right?
actually in this specific case, it’s not. it’s a module_[number string].min.css file
toggling on hsDebug doesn’t have any effect on the 404 issue
huh... interesting.
it just 404's with the unminified url.
HS devs major problem, maybe you already know about it, but css files everywhere are starting to 404, multiple sites affected.
We had 2 separate clients send emails with screenshots showing their websites as plain HTML. Guessing it is this same 404 error issue
Can you link to a page you're seeing that in Jon?
I can't reproduce on my side, but that could be because I'm based in Dublin, we route through a different CDN configuration
shay sent you links - see console to identify the css files
Thanks, I got them, I can repro there
Let me raise the alarm, two mins
in-case it’s CDN related I’m in Wisconsin
just got a 3rd client email with the same issue
I'll send you the links <@U24DCSJBE>
I think the issue is affecting files that were edited less than an hour or two ago
older files are appearing to be unaffected
Thanks for the links all, <@U26D0TF8E> do your examples follow the same pattern as Jon's? I.e. edited in the last hour or two?
no I do not believe so. Only 1 was updated today. We also cannot see the issue like the clients do but we are in different locations as well.
Taking a look at your examples, I wasn't able to reproduce like I could with Jon's. Perhaps unrelated but the team may have an idea what the cause is and are trying a fix right now
both pages I linked you to have come back
the files are working
Should be :+1: the team are clearing caches to be sure but that seems to have fixed it
Thank you, had me worried for a bit
We're digging in on full impact and remediation next-steps, stay tuned

Hi folks, I've updated the Status page for this issue here: <https://status.HubSpot.com/incidents/6cbnzznzlmzk> and our team will continue to determine remediation next steps to prevent this issue going forward.  The impact would have been limited to those updating their CSS or experiencing a cache expiration during the period beginning at 2:51 PM to 3:42 PM  and again at 5:06 PM to 5:58 PM.

How can we add `Custom HTML module` same as other default modules(inbuilt modules) of HubSpot using `DM2`. I could easily add that in `DM1`. I am not able to find same module in the module list of `DM2` and though can't add it.
Can anyone guide me ?
